summary: The OPTN Fee Collection Authority Act (S. 532) authorizes the Secretary of Health and Human Services to collect registration fees from members of the Organ Procurement and Transplantation Network (OPTN). These fees, used solely to support OPTN operations, are to be transparently reported and their use audited by the GAO. The bill also amends existing law to encourage integration of electronic health records and consider a dashboard for transplant statistics. The authority to collect fees sunsets three years after enactment.
